intro: Hibiscus physodes, commonly known as the velvetleaf hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its large, velvety leaves that are typically heart-shaped or ovate in form. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink or red, depending on the species. Hibiscus physodes thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like cotton and okra.
